comments:
if you have an external file in your workspace that does not belong to a project and you ask if it's project exists, it should return false but instead throws an exception:

The stack trace doesn't seem to match the problem description.  If you call IResource.getProject().exists() on a file that doesn't exist, it will not throw an exception. I assume you are getting this stack trace from the log file, where it is logged (and not rethrown) by ResourcePropertyTester. I think it should not even bother logging in this case.
I have removed the statement that was logging this. Behaviour of the property tester is unchanged (as before, it returns false if the resource does not exist).
